summary: This is a formal Touhy request letter from the law firm Edwards Pottinger LLC to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, seeking documentary evidence related to 'Lisa Doe,' a victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The request is made to assist with her civil case and potential claim with the Epstein Victim Compensation Program.

events.title: Filing of Civil Case Lisa Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al.
events.description: A civil lawsuit was filed in the Southern District of New York by Lisa Doe against Darren K. Indyke and others.

events.title: Submission of Touhy Request
events.description: Attorneys for Lisa Doe formally requested documentary evidence from the DOJ/SDNY regarding her abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Establishment of Epstein Victim Compensation Program
events.description: A compensation program for Epstein's victims was established and is currently underway, prompting the need for expedited evidence.

locations: New York Office (of Edwards Pottinger LLC)
keyFacts: The document is a formal Touhy request from victim Lisa Doe's attorneys to the U.S. Attorney's Office, seeking evidence held by the DOJ related to her abuse by Jeffrey Epstein.
The request seeks specific items including photos, videos, correspondence, gift/payment records, and documents revealing Lisa Doe's true name.
The request is made to support Lisa Doe's civil case and her claim with the newly established Epstein Victim Compensation Program.
The letter confirms the existence of an ongoing civil case: 'Lisa Doe v. Darren K. Indyke, et al., SDNY Case No. 1:19-cv-07773.'
The attorneys specify they are not seeking investigatory records that would interfere with ongoing law enforcement proceedings.
